channel.title: CVE Feed for Apple -- tvOS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apple -- tvOS

item.title: CVE-2022-42856|2024-08-03T13:19:05.404Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A type confusion issue was addressed with improved state handling. This issue is fixed in Safari 16.2, tvOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 15.7.2 and iPadOS 15.7.2, iOS 16.1.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15.1..

item.title: CVE-2022-42863|2024-08-03T13:19:05.210Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in Safari 16.2, tvOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-26738|2024-08-03T05:11:44.239Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in tvOS 15.5, macOS Monterey 12.4, iOS 15.5 and iPadOS 15.5. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-46699|2024-08-03T14:39:38.530Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in Safari 16.2, tvOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-26701|2024-08-03T05:11:44.846Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A race condition was addressed with improved locking. This issue is fixed in tvOS 15.5, macOS Monterey 12.4, iOS 15.5 and iPadOS 15.5. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-42851|2024-08-03T13:19:05.284Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, tvOS 16.2. Parsing a maliciously crafted TIFF file may lead to disclosure of user information.

item.title: CVE-2022-46696|2024-08-03T14:39:38.646Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in Safari 16.2, tvOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-46701|2024-08-03T14:39:38.710Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved bounds checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, tvOS 16.2. Connecting to a malicious NFS server may lead to arbitrary code execution with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-42843|2024-08-03T13:19:04.837Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: This issue was addressed with improved data protection. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, tvOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. A user may be able to view sensitive user information.

item.title: CVE-2022-46690|2024-08-03T14:39:38.471Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, tvOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-48618|2024-08-03T15:17:55.511Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Ventura 13.1, watchOS 9.2, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, tvOS 16.2. An attacker with arbitrary read and write capability may be able to bypass Pointer Authentication. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15.7.1.

item.title: CVE-2022-32824|2024-08-03T07:54:01.883Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in tvOS 15.6, watchOS 8.7, iOS 15.6 and iPadOS 15.6. An app may be able to disclose kernel memory.

item.title: CVE-2022-26740|2024-08-03T05:11:44.532Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in tvOS 15.5, macOS Monterey 12.4, iOS 15.5 and iPadOS 15.5. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-42849|2024-08-03T13:19:05.395Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: An access issue existed with privileged API calls. This issue was addressed with additional restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, tvOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. A user may be able to elevate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-42855|2024-08-03T13:19:05.206Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in tvOS 16.2, macOS Monterey 12.6.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 15.7.2 and iPadOS 15.7.2, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2. An app may be able to use arbitrary entitlements.

item.title: CVE-2022-42865|2024-08-03T13:19:05.353Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: This issue was addressed by enabling hardened runtime. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, tvOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. An app may be able to bypass Privacy preferences.

item.title: CVE-2022-26739|2024-08-03T05:11:44.319Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in tvOS 15.5, macOS Monterey 12.4, iOS 15.5 and iPadOS 15.5. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-32830|2024-08-03T07:54:02.303Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: An out-of-bounds read issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in tvOS 15.6, iOS 15.6 and iPadOS 15.6. Processing a maliciously crafted image may lead to disclosure of user information.

item.title: CVE-2022-46700|2024-08-03T14:39:38.248Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved input validation. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-42867|2024-08-03T13:19:05.296Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in Safari 16.2, tvOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-42848|2024-08-03T13:19:04.884Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, iOS 15.7.2 and iPadOS 15.7.2, tvOS 16.2. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-26736|2024-08-03T05:11:44.444Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in tvOS 15.5, macOS Monterey 12.4, iOS 15.5 and iPadOS 15.5. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-46695|2024-08-03T14:39:38.550Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A spoofing issue existed in the handling of URLs. This issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in tvOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 15.7.2 and iPadOS 15.7.2, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. Visiting a website that frames malicious content may lead to UI spoofing.

item.title: CVE-2022-42852|2024-08-03T13:19:04.842Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in Safari 16.2, tvOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 15.7.2 and iPadOS 15.7.2, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content may result in the disclosure of process memory.

item.title: CVE-2022-46691|2024-08-03T14:39:38.517Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A memory consumption issue was addressed with improved memory handling. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-32844|2024-08-03T07:54:03.026Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: A race condition was addressed with improved state handling. This issue is fixed in tvOS 15.6, watchOS 8.7, iOS 15.6 and iPadOS 15.6. An app with arbitrary kernel read and write capability may be able to bypass Pointer Authentication.

item.title: CVE-2022-26724|2024-08-03T05:11:44.389Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: An authentication issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in tvOS 15.5. A local user may be able to enable iCloud Photos without authentication.

item.title: CVE-2022-42866|2024-08-03T13:19:05.209Z -- apple -- tvos
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved handling of caches. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, tvOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. An app may be able to read sensitive location information.

item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.4, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, watchOS 10.4. A malicious application may be able to access private information.
